intro: Chaenorhinum semiglabrum, commonly known as the sticky weed or sticky bluet, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often surrounded by bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily, it is considered a weed in many regions.
